intro: Mackenziea newii, commonly known as the Newii's Mackenziea, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in forested areas. It is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in the understorey of native forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
